newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia noon rubber easier on currency pressure.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia noon rubber easier on currency pressure.

text.p: Indonesian tyre-grade SIR20 rubber prices were weaker in midday trading on Thursday, with buying interest remaining thin and a weaker Malaysian currency adding to the pressure on values, traders said.
They said Malaysian rubber prices were at a discount to Indonesian values following a sharp decline in the ringgit against the U.S. dollar that past few days.
"The Malaysian price for SMR grades is about 1.5 U.S. cents below Indonesia's SIR20 prices," one trader said. "This is putting pressure on local prices."
The traders said they were keeping a close watch on the Indonesian currency, which fell against the dollar following the weakening of the ringgit and the Singapore dollar.
The rupiah was quoted at 2,585 to the dollar at 0520 GMT against an opening of 2,580. It had hit 2,625 earlier.
Traders said buying interest remained thin in Indonesia, despite some enquiries from Europe and Singapore dealers.
They said September shipment SIR20 was quoted at 43.00-43.25 cents/lb fob Medan, 43.00 cents fob Palembang and 42.50-75 cents fob Jambi.
